summary: Little Lyanna
title: Little Lyanna
body:
Summary:  Jon is out of his mind with worry, trying to busy himself as his wife labours their baby into the world… They’ve been trying so long, and they had once thought it would not happen.

Notes: As you know, I am taking part in a challenge on tumblr by user ‘JonerysFic’ and 'MhysaOfDragons’ in which for seven days from Valentines day I am uploading a new one shot. The prompts have been provided and the stories have all been written and I gotta say you’re in for a lot of Jonerys content. So Day 7, the last day, 20th February, which is when I’m uploading this, the prompt I chose was 'Free Choice’. So I got thinking and decided to expand on my glorious reign series and give you the birth of their first child, Lyanna.

Link: https://archiveofourown.org/works/17864576

—-

Jon was going crazy.

Waiting for the arrival of his and Dany’s child had left him drinking with Tyrion in the hands quarter as a promise to Dany that he’d stay away while she laboured their baby. All of the dogs in King’s Landing were howling, due to the storm that had captured the city and by extension scared the inhabitants into staying inside. Lighting and rain, flashing and fierce. There had been four storms since he and Dany assumed the throne five years ago, but this had by far been the worse. Ironic that their child would also be known as Stormborn like it’s mother, but that also left deep rooted fear within Jon himself.

He wondered if she would survive, after all both of their mother’s had perished when giving birth to them, although Sam was dealing with her, the only person he trusted. But there was still this nagging feeling of fear within him that meant he was on edge and pacing the hands chambers all the while it was going on. He could stand on the Balcony and see their chambers from it, but he wouldn’t know what was happening.

They’d lost a babe already, after the first time they’d made love on the boat from dragonstone to White Harbour, Dany’s bleeding had not arrived. They didn’t count their chickens before they hatched, both of them knowing what happened to her last babe, but when her belly had began to swell with life they were joyous. Jon requested they not tell anyone, as only Missandei, Sam and themselves knew at that moment. But about ten weeks after the conception, Dany bled hard and the babe was lost.

She’d cried for weeks in private with him, they’d shared his chambers and it had been heart-wrenching to see her suffer. She put on a smile for the lords of Winterfell, and when they’d caught her crying she’d always played it off as the lose of her Dragon, which in a sense was also her child. So when her belly had become swollen once again six months ago, they’d been very joyous yet extremely cautious. Jon had not let her do anything, she was to relax for the first few months, must to her annoyance.

And now, she was in labour, a month early.

To make matters worse, Lord Baratheon and Lady Stark (Jon’s sister) had sprung upon them a surprise visit, which meant they too were in the hands chambers, drinking with him as the entertainment Tyrion had quickly thrown together for the visiting family got cut short. Daenerys was in the middle of giving a speech when she’d gushed on the floor and began to feel light headed.

She was early, and this was all the more reason Jon was worried. The chances of both of them surviving was very small, but he’d hoped that she had, they both had. If she was to go… Jon couldn’t even bare to think about it, he loved her so hopelessly that the even consideration that Daenerys Targaryen, his wife, his queen, would never see him again, would never look at him with those eyes, was completely consuming him

“Stop pacing, you idiot” Arya grumbled, fiddling with a knife, twisting it between her fingers. The Valyrian blade that Bran had bestowed upon her all those years ago, before he’s met his end… Jon shook his head and did as he was told. He may be the king, but when Ayra said to do something, he listened without question.

“It’s natural to be fearful, Your Grace” Tyrion countered, pouring red wine into his goblet and almost downing it instantly. “But I can assure you she’s in very good hands”

Jon knew she was, Sam had delivered several babies now including that of his sister, Sansa’s two children with her husband up in the north. He may be Lord of Horn Hill, but he also was their maester, and Jon trusted him more than anyone else besides Daenerys.

“Perhaps we can do something to take your mind off of everything, Your Grace?” Gendry offered. Nothing would take Jon’s mind off of it, he knew as such, but he took the bate and sat down at the table with the other three. “Are there any pressing issues that need resolving in the city?”

“We’ve been dealing with a speight of theft in flea bottom” Jon shrugs, reminding himself that flea bottom needs to be renamed as it wasn’t the hive of poverty it had once been in the era of the Lannisters rule. Jon and Dany had more than enough comforts here in the Red Keep that he’d make monthly donations of food and clothes that were worn by servants down to them and handed them out personally.

“Okay, let’s focus on that then”

It worked for maybe twenty minutes, until Jon swore he heard screaming all the way across the Red Keep. He knows he didn’t, it was more than likely his mind playing tricks on him, but still, it was enough to stop him from wanting to commit to the City’s issues and think about her instead.

He didn’t pray to the old gods, after all he’s seen in the world he doubted any god’s existence anymore, but he did pray to Sam’s ability that he’d keep her alive, both of them. He should’ve ignored Dany, stayed with her until the end, but it had been hours and she’d begged him to go until it was done. He wouldn’t if it was a case of not wanting to seem weak, or not wanting to see the birth, or perhaps if she did pass, she didn’t want him to see it in front of his eyes.

Whatever her reasons, it was a decision that was driving him crazy and fearful and almost alone.

“Sansa has birthed two children, both of which were successfully delivered by Sam, stop having a crisis you’ll look like you’re supposed to be celebrating your fiftieth name day” Arya was growing impatient and Jon did not blame her in the slightest, but had they known about the baby they lost, then perhaps she’d know why he was frightened for his Queen.

Sansa knew now, shortly after the war and her engagement and subsequent wedding to Gawen of House Glover, she’d come to Jon about bleeding heavily and unsure of anyone to turn too. She’d suffered a miscarriage and it had affected her mentally. Jon had offered comfort and told her the story of her and Dany losing one and from that moment, Sansa had dealt with the issue better.

“I’m her husband, she’s my Queen, let me worry” Jon sighs, thinking back to the times in which his worries were the living dead killing all of men-kind.

So much had changed and so much was still to change now that he and Daenerys were to become parents. The capital had been so happy at the news of their King and Queen welcoming a child soon, and thankfully, the other lords in the kingdom had too. Jon had struggled with it on some occasions. A child was something Jon had always wanted but never envisioned he would have when he was serving on the wall, but something that had come true and very shortly, he’d have to be a father.

Would he be a good one?

“Your Grace” Jon hears behind him and so he turns to note several guardsmen and Sam, the Maester and man he trusted amongst everyone else. He was covered in blood, as was to be expected after delivering a baby, but his appearance still filled him with dread.

“Is everything alright?” Tyrion is the first one to speak.

“Mother and babe are both alright” Sam nods and Jon almost wants to fall to his knees. The relief that over spills in his body is almost too much to handle. He doesn’t know whether to sit down, to run to Dany’s side, to kiss Sam even. “The Queen has lost a lot of blood however, so she needs to rest up for a few weeks, eat plenty and drink lots of water to get her up and running again” Sam takes a small pause. “It’s a girl”

Arya squeals piercingly into the air and yet Jon isn’t affected by it, he’s just shocked, his entire system falling apart as he imagines a small girl in his arms. A girl, a little daughter to call my own, our beautiful miracle, our beloved angel . Jon needs to see them both, he need to hold her in her arms and look at the beautiful life he and Dany created together.

“Can I seem them?” Jon ask, knowing that even if Sam said know he’d still go anyways. Sam just nods and that’s all Jon needs to start a quick pace towards his own bedchambers.

The halls are quiet when he leaves Tyrion’s chambers, only guardsmen with smiles on their faces as Jon feels glee and anticipation build in his chest. He follows the way to his chambers that he was so familiar with at this point, seeing servants cleaning and clearing stuff away, seeing cats up on the balcony, seeing the steps to their space. She was there, his little princess was waiting for him, and his queen too.

When he reached the door to his chambers, he was greeted by Missandei who was holding sheets covered in blood, she was smiling brightly when her eyes connected with Dany’s. Clearly happy both the Queen and the girl were okay. She gleefully grins before heading off in the direction Jon came from, leaving him to open the door.

The sound he was greeted with was like music to his eyes, a soft gurgling and a sweet song that melted away every fear in his body. He did not know the song, he thinks perhaps she made it up, but her voice is tunely and melodic and the happiness that was radiating from it was enough to send Jon wild. He sees them then, Dany, sat up in the bed with a small clothed babe in her arms. Jon, in an instant, is at her side.

“Stars above” Jon whispers as Dany kisses him on the cheek. “She’s absolutely perfect”

As he looked at her, he notices she has been born with a thick head full of hair, black hair like his own and a little bit all over the place. Her eyes however, magnificently violet and delightfully wild. Jon knows the babe can’t see them both yet, but she was content just being in her mother’s arm.

“I’m glad you’re here” Dany sighed, Jon knew she was tired. “She needs to hear her Father speak to her”

She passed him over and for what felt like hours, Jon just held her in his arms and looked at her. She was the most perfect creation that has ever been because of him. He loved her with every drop of blood in his veins, every breath in his lungs and ever word in his mouth. He whispered to her, promised her that he would protect her until his last breath, love her until he could not any longer and he even shed tears. He was sensitive in the moment but he did not care.

She was a dream.

“I want to call her Lyanna” He says out of nowhere, not having heard anything Dany had said, just cut off from it all as he stared at the perfect babe in his arms. “I think my mother deserves that” He stated. After everything his own mother went through, everything she and his real father gave up for him, and after wanting to know about her and finally finding out the truth, Jon felt sure that was the little babe in his arms name. “If that’s okay with you”

“Little Lyanna Targaryen” She sighs, sleep wanting to take his wife over. She was now laying down, hoping to get a moment of sleep. Jon did not mind, it meant he got to hold his babe for longer. Little Lyanna Targaryen, it was. “I like it, then if we have another one, we’ll call him Robb”

If we have another one, we’ll call him Robb.

Jon liked the idea, but they had everything they needed for now. Him, his queen and their beautiful Princess Lyanna. A life Jon never envisioned, but one he was grateful of nonetheless.

Her eyes however, magnificently violet and delightfully wild. Jon knows the babe can’t see them both yet, but she was content just being in her mother’s arm.

“I’m glad you’re here” Dany sighed, Jon knew she was tired. “She needs to hear her Father speak to her”

She passed him over and for what felt like hours, Jon just held her in his arms and looked at her. She was the most perfect creation that has ever been because of him. He loved her with every drop of blood in his veins, every breath in his lungs and ever word in his mouth. He whispered to her, promised her that he would protect her until his last breath, love her until he could not any longer and he even shed tears. He was sensitive in the moment but he did not care.

She was a dream.

“I want to call her Lyanna” He says out of nowhere, not having heard anything Dany had said, just cut off from it all as he stared at the perfect babe in his arms. “I think my mother deserves that” He stated. After everything his own mother went through, everything she and his real father gave up for him, and after wanting to know about her and finally finding out the truth, Jon felt sure that was the little babe in his arms name. “If that’s okay with you”

“Little Lyanna Targaryen” She sighs, sleep wanting to take his wife over. She was now laying down, hoping to get a moment of sleep. Jon did not mind, it meant he got to hold his babe for longer. Little Lyanna Targaryen, it was. “I like it, then if we have another one, we’ll call him Robb”

If we have another one, we’ll call him Robb.

Jon liked the idea, but they had everything they needed for now. Him, his queen and their beautiful Princess Lyanna. A life Jon never envisioned, but one he was grateful of nonetheless.

Summary:  Jon is out of his mind with worry, trying to busy himself as his wife labours their baby into the world… They’ve been trying so long, and they had once thought it would not happen.

Notes: As you know, I am taking part in a challenge on tumblr by user ‘JonerysFic’ and 'MhysaOfDragons’ in which for seven days from Valentines day I am uploading a new one shot. The prompts have been provided and the stories have all been written and I gotta say you’re in for a lot of Jonerys content. So Day 7, the last day, 20th February, which is when I’m uploading this, the prompt I chose was 'Free Choice’. So I got thinking and decided to expand on my glorious reign series and give you the birth of their first child, Lyanna.

Link: https://archiveofourown.org/works/17864576

—-

Jon was going crazy.

Waiting for the arrival of his and Dany’s child had left him drinking with Tyrion in the hands quarter as a promise to Dany that he’d stay away while she laboured their baby. All of the dogs in King’s Landing were howling, due to the storm that had captured the city and by extension scared the inhabitants into staying inside. Lighting and rain, flashing and fierce. There had been four storms since he and Dany assumed the throne five years ago, but this had by far been the worse. Ironic that their child would also be known as Stormborn like it’s mother, but that also left deep rooted fear within Jon himself.

[[MORE]]

He wondered if she would survive, after all both of their mother’s had perished when giving birth to them, although Sam was dealing with her, the only person he trusted. But there was still this nagging feeling of fear within him that meant he was on edge and pacing the hands chambers all the while it was going on. He could stand on the Balcony and see their chambers from it, but he wouldn’t know what was happening.

They’d lost a babe already, after the first time they’d made love on the boat from dragonstone to White Harbour, Dany’s bleeding had not arrived. They didn’t count their chickens before they hatched, both of them knowing what happened to her last babe, but when her belly had began to swell with life they were joyous. Jon requested they not tell anyone, as only Missandei, Sam and themselves knew at that moment. But about ten weeks after the conception, Dany bled hard and the babe was lost.

She’d cried for weeks in private with him, they’d shared his chambers and it had been heart-wrenching to see her suffer. She put on a smile for the lords of Winterfell, and when they’d caught her crying she’d always played it off as the lose of her Dragon, which in a sense was also her child. So when her belly had become swollen once again six months ago, they’d been very joyous yet extremely cautious. Jon had not let her do anything, she was to relax for the first few months, must to her annoyance.

And now, she was in labour, a month early.

To make matters worse, Lord Baratheon and Lady Stark (Jon’s sister) had sprung upon them a surprise visit, which meant they too were in the hands chambers, drinking with him as the entertainment Tyrion had quickly thrown together for the visiting family got cut short. Daenerys was in the middle of giving a speech when she’d gushed on the floor and began to feel light headed.

She was early, and this was all the more reason Jon was worried. The chances of both of them surviving was very small, but he’d hoped that she had, they both had. If she was to go… Jon couldn’t even bare to think about it, he loved her so hopelessly that the even consideration that Daenerys Targaryen, his wife, his queen, would never see him again, would never look at him with those eyes, was completely consuming him

“Stop pacing, you idiot” Arya grumbled, fiddling with a knife, twisting it between her fingers. The Valyrian blade that Bran had bestowed upon her all those years ago, before he’s met his end… Jon shook his head and did as he was told. He may be the king, but when Ayra said to do something, he listened without question.

“It’s natural to be fearful, Your Grace” Tyrion countered, pouring red wine into his goblet and almost downing it instantly. “But I can assure you she’s in very good hands”

Jon knew she was, Sam had delivered several babies now including that of his sister, Sansa’s two children with her husband up in the north. He may be Lord of Horn Hill, but he also was their maester, and Jon trusted him more than anyone else besides Daenerys.

“Perhaps we can do something to take your mind off of everything, Your Grace?” Gendry offered. Nothing would take Jon’s mind off of it, he knew as such, but he took the bate and sat down at the table with the other three. “Are there any pressing issues that need resolving in the city?”

“We’ve been dealing with a speight of theft in flea bottom” Jon shrugs, reminding himself that flea bottom needs to be renamed as it wasn’t the hive of poverty it had once been in the era of the Lannisters rule. Jon and Dany had more than enough comforts here in the Red Keep that he’d make monthly donations of food and clothes that were worn by servants down to them and handed them out personally.

“Okay, let’s focus on that then”

It worked for maybe twenty minutes, until Jon swore he heard screaming all the way across the Red Keep. He knows he didn’t, it was more than likely his mind playing tricks on him, but still, it was enough to stop him from wanting to commit to the City’s issues and think about her instead.

He didn’t pray to the old gods, after all he’s seen in the world he doubted any god’s existence anymore, but he did pray to Sam’s ability that he’d keep her alive, both of them. He should’ve ignored Dany, stayed with her until the end, but it had been hours and she’d begged him to go until it was done. He wouldn’t if it was a case of not wanting to seem weak, or not wanting to see the birth, or perhaps if she did pass, she didn’t want him to see it in front of his eyes.

Whatever her reasons, it was a decision that was driving him crazy and fearful and almost alone.

“Sansa has birthed two children, both of which were successfully delivered by Sam, stop having a crisis you’ll look like you’re supposed to be celebrating your fiftieth name day” Arya was growing impatient and Jon did not blame her in the slightest, but had they known about the baby they lost, then perhaps she’d know why he was frightened for his Queen.

Sansa knew now, shortly after the war and her engagement and subsequent wedding to Gawen of House Glover, she’d come to Jon about bleeding heavily and unsure of anyone to turn too. She’d suffered a miscarriage and it had affected her mentally. Jon had offered comfort and told her the story of her and Dany losing one and from that moment, Sansa had dealt with the issue better.

“I’m her husband, she’s my Queen, let me worry” Jon sighs, thinking back to the times in which his worries were the living dead killing all of men-kind.

So much had changed and so much was still to change now that he and Daenerys were to become parents. The capital had been so happy at the news of their King and Queen welcoming a child soon, and thankfully, the other lords in the kingdom had too. Jon had struggled with it on some occasions. A child was something Jon had always wanted but never envisioned he would have when he was serving on the wall, but something that had come true and very shortly, he’d have to be a father.

Would he be a good one?

“Your Grace” Jon hears behind him and so he turns to note several guardsmen and Sam, the Maester and man he trusted amongst everyone else. He was covered in blood, as was to be expected after delivering a baby, but his appearance still filled him with dread.

“Is everything alright?” Tyrion is the first one to speak.

“Mother and babe are both alright” Sam nods and Jon almost wants to fall to his knees. The relief that over spills in his body is almost too much to handle. He doesn’t know whether to sit down, to run to Dany’s side, to kiss Sam even. “The Queen has lost a lot of blood however, so she needs to rest up for a few weeks, eat plenty and drink lots of water to get her up and running again” Sam takes a small pause. “It’s a girl”

Arya squeals piercingly into the air and yet Jon isn’t affected by it, he’s just shocked, his entire system falling apart as he imagines a small girl in his arms. A girl, a little daughter to call my own, our beautiful miracle, our beloved angel . Jon needs to see them both, he need to hold her in her arms and look at the beautiful life he and Dany created together.

“Can I seem them?” Jon ask, knowing that even if Sam said know he’d still go anyways. Sam just nods and that’s all Jon needs to start a quick pace towards his own bedchambers.

The halls are quiet when he leaves Tyrion’s chambers, only guardsmen with smiles on their faces as Jon feels glee and anticipation build in his chest. He follows the way to his chambers that he was so familiar with at this point, seeing servants cleaning and clearing stuff away, seeing cats up on the balcony, seeing the steps to their space. She was there, his little princess was waiting for him, and his queen too.

When he reached the door to his chambers, he was greeted by Missandei who was holding sheets covered in blood, she was smiling brightly when her eyes connected with Dany’s. Clearly happy both the Queen and the girl were okay. She gleefully grins before heading off in the direction Jon came from, leaving him to open the door.

The sound he was greeted with was like music to his eyes, a soft gurgling and a sweet song that melted away every fear in his body. He did not know the song, he thinks perhaps she made it up, but her voice is tunely and melodic and the happiness that was radiating from it was enough to send Jon wild. He sees them then, Dany, sat up in the bed with a small clothed babe in her arms. Jon, in an instant, is at her side.

“Stars above” Jon whispers as Dany kisses him on the cheek. “She’s absolutely perfect”

As he looked at her, he notices she has been born with a thick head full of hair, black hair like his own and a little bit all over the place. Her eyes however, magnificently violet and delightfully wild. Jon knows the babe can’t see them both yet, but she was content just being in her mother’s arm.

“I’m glad you’re here” Dany sighed, Jon knew she was tired. “She needs to hear her Father speak to her”

She passed him over and for what felt like hours, Jon just held her in his arms and looked at her. She was the most perfect creation that has ever been because of him. He loved her with every drop of blood in his veins, every breath in his lungs and ever word in his mouth. He whispered to her, promised her that he would protect her until his last breath, love her until he could not any longer and he even shed tears. He was sensitive in the moment but he did not care.

She was a dream.

“I want to call her Lyanna” He says out of nowhere, not having heard anything Dany had said, just cut off from it all as he stared at the perfect babe in his arms. “I think my mother deserves that” He stated. After everything his own mother went through, everything she and his real father gave up for him, and after wanting to know about her and finally finding out the truth, Jon felt sure that was the little babe in his arms name. “If that’s okay with you”

“Little Lyanna Targaryen” She sighs, sleep wanting to take his wife over. She was now laying down, hoping to get a moment of sleep. Jon did not mind, it meant he got to hold his babe for longer. Little Lyanna Targaryen, it was. “I like it, then if we have another one, we’ll call him Robb”

If we have another one, we’ll call him Robb.

Jon liked the idea, but they had everything they needed for now. Him, his queen and their beautiful Princess Lyanna. A life Jon never envisioned, but one he was grateful of nonetheless.

body:

Aujourd’hui, parlons d’une toute nouvelle série, encore peu connue, Games of Thrones :p
Je dois dire que j’ai eu beaucoup de mal avec cette série, voilà pourquoi ma chronique arrive si tard, alors que toute la planète a déjà tout vu :p
Alors ? Vais-je me faire des ennemis avec cet article ? Il va falloir continuer à lire pour le savoir 😉

summary: Dany and loss
title: Dany and loss
body:
In the suffering Olympics that often take place in this fandom, one often hears that Dany never loses. She has it too easy. She never loses anything.

But seriously, what did she even have to lose?

You can try to compare her to the Starks. First they lost their father.

By the time Dany was born she had no father.

The Starks were betrayed and lost their mother and oldest brother.

Dany never had a Mother (died in birthing her). Her oldest brother was dead already. All she ever heard were stories.

The Starks lost their ancestral home of Winterfell

Dany had to abandon her ancestral home while a baby and ran from free city to free city.

The Starks had to grow up (at a certain point of their lives) cut off from the love, affection and stable household they had become accustomed to.

Dany never had these things. Her fondest memory is of a place where she had a little bit of stability and had “her own room” in the house with the red door. She was kicked out of there with Viserys when their caretaker died. Her brother may have loved her once but certainly didn’t by the time he sold her to the Dothraki.

The Starks lost their traditional position of power and that they had grown up with (Winterfell and the North). Dany grew up hearing stories that her family had once had these but never even saw them.

She spent an entire life without any of these supports. When she tried to form some attachments among the Dothraki, her husband died, the son she was hoping for died, and she was once again abandoned.

When it comes to love, family, a home etc. she never had any. And then she was told to give up any hope of it since she had no family and could not have any children either. What she has managed to gain is power and followers. That is literally the only things she has to lose. And people want her to lose all of that too coz she ‘never has to lose anything.’

She does try to replace the family she never had by making dear friends. She loses them too. One of her closest maids betrayed her and killed the other. Then she learned that her closest friend (Jorah) had been betraying her. Then she lost the Knight she had come to trust and rely on (Barristan). She still has some friends left.  Even those she will probably lose. How many think that Jorah or Greyworm will actually survive? And it seems that Tyrion may betray her as well. Do we really think she’ll come out of the Great War with even most of her followers intact?

And oh, she thought that at least her connection with the dragons was reliable and they would be with her forever and outlast her (in the books she hopes they can continue the Targaryen name when she is gone). Now she’s lost a dragon too. Who knows if she’s going to lose another before this war is done?

And now she has gained Jon as someone to love who loves her back. Now people want him to betray her too and lose that as well. Because apparently she never loses anything and is a Mary Sue.

The fact is that almost all her gains and victories that irk antis so are mainly military and political. She has those and many of their faves cannot compare in those areas so they cry ‘no fair’. Because she has hardly ever been in a weak position on those fronts (at least since 3x04). But on a personal level Dany is in a state of deep and perpetual loss with nothing stable to stand on.

summary: I really wish they hadn’t tried to so hard to make Daenerys such a good character. I realize they wanted a foil to Cersei’s...
body: I really wish they hadn’t tried to so hard to make Daenerys such a good character. I realize they wanted a foil to Cersei’s heartlessness but they just ended up making Dany so archetypical. I would have enjoyed her so much more if they let her be crazy and passionate like a Targaryen is. Instead they only let it show in small doses and then every other character is like “whoooooa Dany, calm down”, but those are honestly the only times that I enjoy Daenerys. She has so much more potential if they weren’t so focused on making her “likable” and just really went all out with her character. Like as far as Targaryen’s go she’s the only one we really got to see and I feel like she was so watered down. And I understand she’s scared to be like her father or brother but I think in a really wicked way that it would be dementedly satisfying to watch her struggle with her innate self and become the crazy ruler she constantly fought against being.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: A post on the Jon Snow tag with gifs of Mance being burned by Stannis with Tormund and Jon’s angry/horrified faces  - of course...
body:
A post on the Jon Snow tag with gifs of Mance being burned by Stannis with Tormund and Jon’s angry/horrified faces  - of course this post is to show that Dany is evil and has nothing to do with Stannis considering all the folks reblogging and commenting on this. 

This comment by the Jonsa Lawyer stood out:

One thing particularly striking about death by fire is it’s essentially impossible to die with any dignity in that situation…which is basically the point.

Like really?

How did this guy die then?

He died with dignity? Or begging and pleading for a second chance? Which Jon did not give him because Jon needed to make a stand and a statement about his authority as Lord Commander.

How was Janos Slynt’s death more dignified than this?

Dany too needed to make a statement about her authority with these lords who kept openly defying her.  Dany was actually even more lenient than Jon - she offered them two chances - bend the knee/go to the wall. Unlike Slynt, they refused to do either.

If we are talking about her battle against the Lannisters….

How is this more dignified than someone dying slowly in the battle of the bastards with their guts hanging out?

See all the dead people behind Robb? I doubt they had dignified deaths…

Remember those dead soldiers that the Tarlys and Jaime slew in Highgarden? Hell, Dickon describes feeling bad about the smell and the deaths of people he used to call friends. Think they had nice, easy dignified deaths at the hands of those they used to consider brothers in arms?

How about all those Wildlings that died when Jon Snow poured hot oil on them and then burned them with fire tipped arrows? Dignified deaths?

Did Olly have a dignified death? A child hanging with his tongue sticking out? Probably lost control of his bowels.

What about when Tyrion blew people up with Wildfire?

What about when Ned and Stannis crushed the Ironborn rebellion against the Iron Throne and killled many including Theon’s brothers. Dignified deaths there?

War is bad and death is death - death is ugly. There is nothing dignified about death in Westeros.  No matter who is involved - be it Robb, Jon, Sansa, Jaime, Stannis, Tyrion, Joffrey, Tywin, Ned, Renly or Dany.

There is no good war or bad war. No good death or bad death. They are all the same.

Don’t be hypocrites. If you want to criticize Dany for her war, then be an equal opportunity critic and criticize everyone.


And since you all are big fans of the kindest, most compassionate mother Theresa of the North who does not have a new costume because she is sewing through the night for all of the north and saving fabric to make clothes for them, understand that she too waged war against the Warden of the North. As she keeps reminding everyone, she won the BOTB with a Vale army - that slew thousands of men - who all died with no dignity on the battlefield with their limbs chopped off, their guts hanging out and probably shitting themselves while dying. Very dignified indeed.

Don’t be hypocrites. If you want to criticize Dany for her war, then be an equal opportunity critic and criticize everyone.


And since you all are big fans of the kindest, most compassionate mother Theresa of the North who does not have a new costume because she is sewing through the night for all of the north and saving fabric to make clothes for them, understand that she too waged war against the Warden of the North. As she keeps reminding everyone, she won the BOTB with a Vale army - that slew thousands of men - who all died with no dignity on the battlefield with their limbs chopped off, their guts hanging out and probably shitting themselves while dying. Very dignified indeed.
trail.content:
A post on the Jon Snow tag with gifs of Mance being burned by Stannis with Tormund and Jon’s angry/horrified faces  - of course this post is to show that Dany is evil and has nothing to do with Stannis considering all the folks reblogging and commenting on this. 

This comment by the Jonsa Lawyer stood out:

One thing particularly striking about death by fire is it’s essentially impossible to die with any dignity in that situation…which is basically the point.

Like really?

How did this guy die then?

He died with dignity? Or begging and pleading for a second chance? Which Jon did not give him because Jon needed to make a stand and a statement about his authority as Lord Commander.

How was Janos Slynt’s death more dignified than this?

Dany too needed to make a statement about her authority with these lords who kept openly defying her.  Dany was actually even more lenient than Jon - she offered them two chances - bend the knee/go to the wall. Unlike Slynt, they refused to do either.

If we are talking about her battle against the Lannisters….

How is this more dignified than someone dying slowly in the battle of the bastards with their guts hanging out?

See all the dead people behind Robb? I doubt they had dignified deaths…

Remember those dead soldiers that the Tarlys and Jaime slew in Highgarden? Hell, Dickon describes feeling bad about the smell and the deaths of people he used to call friends. Think they had nice, easy dignified deaths at the hands of those they used to consider brothers in arms?

How about all those Wildlings that died when Jon Snow poured hot oil on them and then burned them with fire tipped arrows? Dignified deaths?

Did Olly have a dignified death? A child hanging with his tongue sticking out? Probably lost control of his bowels.

What about when Tyrion blew people up with Wildfire?

What about when Ned and Stannis crushed the Ironborn rebellion against the Iron Throne and killled many including Theon’s brothers. Dignified deaths there?

War is bad and death is death - death is ugly. There is nothing dignified about death in Westeros.  No matter who is involved - be it Robb, Jon, Sansa, Jaime, Stannis, Tyrion, Joffrey, Tywin, Ned, Renly or Dany.

There is no good war or bad war. No good death or bad death. They are all the same.

Don’t be hypocrites. If you want to criticize Dany for her war, then be an equal opportunity critic and criticize everyone.

Very dignified indeed.

blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

summary: What do you think is the central moral struggle for jon, arya, bran, sansa, dany and tyrion.  I think for arya it's about mercy...
question: What do you think is the central moral struggle for jon, arya, bran, sansa, dany and tyrion.  I think for arya it's about mercy vs revenge.  For sansa I think its about truth vs lies.  I'm struggling with the other four and i'm not so sure about arya and sansa.
answer:
Asoiaf/got characters are so complex and well written that their stories feature many moral struggles. The answers to the question of the major moral conflict each character faces would be varied within our fandom. That’s because each person tends to focus on different aspects on the stories they read.

I agree with your opinion on Sansa. She keeps getting better at lying and she’s currently relying on her fake identity to survive. But just because she says lies that doesn’t necessary means that she likes it. I believe that soon will come a time where she will have to choose between continuing the easy road of lying or following the hard path of truth. I’m rooting for the second. After all, Sansa never wanted to play the game of thrones herself.

I can see why you picked that struggle for Arya but for me her major one is choosing between being alone (and No One) and being part of the pack (and a Stark). Ned’s famous quote about the lone wolf dying and  the pack surviving keeps reappearing on some crucial scenes in her point of view for a reason. I think it’s because so far Arya has achieved more things while being alone while tragedy has befallen to her family members who weren’t alone (Catelyn and Robb, Bran and Rickon). But this quote coming from a person she really respected (her father) is a reminder that maybe on the darkest days to come will be better to be part of the pack instead of being alone.

Moving on to Jon, I think his major struggle is between doing his duty and doing what he believes it’s the right thing. Jon always wanted to appear a dutiful person and not to be associated with the bastard’s stigma (aka the bastard’s honor). However, he also has a strong sense of justice that often conflicts with his duty. This is evident on the fifth book where that struggle of his takes central place and in the end it’s partly the reason why he got killed. 

Daenerys most struggles come from her queedom. Daenerys doesn’t have an older relative or a mentor to help her navigate the path of a leader and often questions her actions as the Queen. The major struggle being torn between being a merciful queen and a successful one. It comes natural to her to help others since she has been through so much all her life. That often comes in conflict with her wanting to follow the steps of her successful ancestors. The dragons plant to trees is a quote that shows exactly this. Thankfully Daenerys isn’t only a dragon but a Mhysa as well. 

I admit that I’m not sure about the major struggle of Bran and Tyruon(if they have a single major conflict at all). However I’ll give it a try. 

Bran : so far his major inner struggle is about whether he should continue using Hodor’s body for his own means. Bran’s young age pretends us from seeing his actions in such a bad light as we would do if he was older. However, ripping someone off his free will is not a morally good action and I believe that Bran will come to realize it on the last two books.

 Tyrion : I think his major struggle is choosing whether he will lived hunted by his past ghosts or learning from the past. He’s a character who has faced many hardships in his life and for a lot of shit he’s going through his family is to blame. On the fifth book, he was at his lowest “defeated” by the past ghosts and having little hope for the future. But at some point on the future books he’ll have to decide whether he’ll let everything that happened in the past bring him down or if he’ll take a brave step forward, not forgetting his past but also no letting it define him.
